syllabus:
Course introduction

This course maps the design history from various perspectives, such as tools for prehumans to modern society, ancient European religious ornamentation, and the industrial revolution to modern design history. Each lecture focuses on how design plays a critical role in historical moments and leads to the next phase of history. This course aims to establish students' more profound understanding of design history and provide opportunities to gain professional knowledge in the design industry. 

Course Goals

1.  To understand the importance of design in each historical moment
2.  To acknowledge historical design movement and its outcomes
3.  To expand knowledge of historical designer and their masterpieces
4.  To understand how society affects the culture and design development
5.  To apply the knowledge of lectures to students' professional development

Course Theme

This class is to understand how design industry has evolved in the past in western and eastern countries to define the importance of design. There are three levels of focus on this class, which are Design Ability, Socio-cultural Dynamics, and the brief history of Modern Design. During the session of Design Ability, the class points the origin of design as tool development, while Socio-cultural Dynamics session argues how design development was sensitive to its local culture.  The last session is to go through the brief history of Modern Design which is a new approach to the design development after the industrial revolution.
